skill.name: standup-formatter
skill.description: Use when generating standup reports, daily updates, or team status summaries. Formats work activity into concise standup format.
skill.summary: Use when generating standup reports, daily updates, or team status summaries. Formats work activity ...
skill.author: ChaiWithJai

security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation-based skill with no executable code. All 19 static findings are false positives: the scanner misidentified markdown code formatting (backticks) as shell execution, and misinterpreted text descriptions containing words like 'report' and 'update' as cryptographic patterns. The skill only contains guidelines and templates for formatting standup reports.

content.value_statement: Struggling to write concise daily standups that actually help your team? This skill transforms your work activity into properly formatted standup reports that focus on outcomes, not just activities.
actual_capabilities: Formats work activity into concise standup reports
Provides templates for individual and team standups
Focuses on outcomes rather than activities
Supports both async written and sync spoken formats
limitations: Does not automatically fetch data from external sources
Requires manual input of completed work and plans
No integration with project management tools
Cannot track or store historical standup data

use_cases.title: Daily Development Updates
use_cases.description: Transform git commits and code reviews into concise standup reports that highlight actual progress and blockers

use_cases.title: Team Status Aggregation
use_cases.description: Compile individual updates into a unified team standup that identifies cross-dependencies and shared blockers

use_cases.title: Async Team Communication
use_cases.description: Create detailed written standups for distributed teams across different time zones

prompt_templates.title: Basic Daily Standup
prompt_templates.prompt: Format this into a proper standup: Yesterday I fixed the login bug and merged PR #123. Today I'm working on the payment integration.

prompt_templates.title: Team Standup Compilation
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a team standup from these individual updates: Alice finished user testing, Bob fixed 3 bugs, Carol waiting on design approval

prompt_templates.title: Weekly Summary Format
prompt_templates.scenario: Convert weekly work to standup format
prompt_templates.prompt: Transform my weekly activities into a standup format focusing on key deliverables: Completed user authentication and database migration

prompt_templates.title: Blocker-Focused Standup
prompt_templates.prompt: Format this update to emphasize blockers: Implemented API endpoints but tests failing due to database issues

output_examples.input: Yesterday I worked on the user profile page, fixed some CSS issues, and had a meeting with the design team. Today I'll continue with the profile features and start working on the settings page. No blockers.
output: - Aligned with design team on requirements

output_examples.input: Yesterday I fixed the login bug and merged PR #123. Today I'm working on the payment integration. I'm blocked waiting for the API documentation from the backend team.
output: - Waiting on API documentation from backend team

output_examples.input: Alice finished user testing and started documentation. Bob fixed 3 bugs and needs code review. Carol is waiting on design approval for the new dashboard.
output: - Blockers: Waiting on design approval for new dashboard

best_practices: Focus on completed outcomes, not hours worked or activities performed
Keep each section to 2-3 bullet points maximum for clarity
Make blockers specific and actionable with clear help needed
anti_patterns: Listing every single task or meeting attended
Using vague descriptions like worked on stuff or made progress
Saying no blockers when actually stuck or waiting on something

faq.question: Is this compatible with my team's existing standup format?
faq.answer: Yes, the templates follow industry-standard standup formats and can be customized to match your team's specific style.

faq.question: What if I have more than 3 items to share?
faq.answer: Focus on the most important 2-3 items. Save additional details for follow-up discussions or async channels.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my project management tools?
faq.answer: Currently this is a standalone formatting tool. You will need to manually input your work items from other tools.

faq.question: How does this handle sensitive project information?
faq.answer: The skill processes text locally without sending data to external services, keeping your project details secure.

faq.question: What if I am stuck but do not know how to phrase the blocker?
faq.answer: The skill helps identify and phrase blockers clearly, suggesting specific help needed rather than vague statements.

faq.question: How is this different from using a generic text formatter?
faq.answer: This skill understands standup best practices and automatically structures content for maximum team communication value.
